name: Please Stand By -I Got Something To Say 046
description: Please Stand By utilizes the iconic SMPTE color bars template and changes the palette to bring into question viewers perceptions surrounding "standards of color." An offshoot of my original series, I Got Something To Say, adds an additional more literal message. Please Stand By, The Revolution Will Not Be Televised, an homage to the late Gil Scott-Heron’s famous spoken word poem. I think this poem is just as meaningful today as it was when he wrote it in 1971. Looking back at the race riots of the 1970’s, it has sometimes looked like not much has changed in our country in the past 50 years. Racial inequity still bears down heavily on the black community, police openly shoot or assault unarmed black men in the streets often with no consequence, and boiling points have been reached for many across the country. But the revolution will not be televised, nor will it be twitterized. It won’t come from something you see on TV or read on twitter, the change needs to take place in our minds and hearts, as Heron said “you have to change your mind before you change the way you live and the way you move.” Hopefully the past year has moved our country and our minds in the right direction.
